definitions.definition: The arrangement or placement of certain things.
definitions.example: The scouts reported on the disposition of the enemy troops.

definitions.definition: Tendency or inclination under given circumstances.
definitions.example: I have little disposition now to do as you say.
He has such a foul disposition.
You will have full disposition of these funds.

definitions.definition: Transfer or relinquishment to the care or possession of another.
definitions.example: The court ordered the disposition of all assets.
The disposition of the case will be announced tomorrow.

definitions.definition: The destination of a patient after medical treatment such as surgery.
definitions.example: The patient was given a disposition for outpatient care.

definitions.definition: The set of choirs of strings on a harpsichord.
definitions.example: This small harpsichord has a 1 x 4' disposition.

definitions.definition: To remove or place in a different position.
